intro: Vexibia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf vexibia, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
